div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1780 Tell Ahmar (anc. Til-Barsib), Meso- potamia, on the road between Hierapolis in Cyrrhestica and Edessa in Mesopotamia at the crossing of the Euphrates, 1929 Burial: 110-105 B.C. (M) Contents: 70 AR. Pot hoard from excavations Athens: 10 New Style tetradr. (5*, latest 173/2 B.C., Thompson) Antiochus VII: 28 tetradr. (Antiocheia 19*) Demetrius II: 4 tetradr. (Antiocheia 2*, Damascus 1*) Antiochus VIII: 18 tetradr. (Antiocheia 7*, Damascus 2*, Ace 1*) Antiochus IX: 8 tetradr. (Antiocheia 4*, Ace 2*) Unc.: 2 tetradr. Disposition: Damascus 43 (as starred) Thureau-Dangin and Dunand, Til-Barsib (Paris, 1936), pp. 81 f. Bellinger, AJA 1938, p. 318 Rostovtzeff, Anatolian Stud. Buckler, p. 298 Thompson, Athens, p. 474; NC 1962, pp. 310 f. Lewis, NC 1962, p. 279 Seyrig, Tr√©sors du Levant (in press) Only the coins at Damascus were accessible for inspection. The totals are those of Thureau-Dangin and Dunand
